com.mapbox.vision

Class VisionManager

  • com.mapbox.vision.VisionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ARDataProvider

    public class VisionManager
implements ARDataProvider

    The main object for registering for events from the library, starting and stopping their delivery.

    It also provides some useful functions for performance configuration and data conversion.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static VisionManager INSTANCE
      The main object for registering for events from the library, starting and stopping their delivery.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void create()
      Initialize SDK. Creates core services and allocates necessary resources. Typically is called when application need to launch Vision SDK, eg. android.app.Activity.onCreate. You should VisionManager.destroy when Vision SDK is no longer needed to release all resources. No-op if called while SDK is created already.
      void destroy()
      Releases all resources. Typically this is called from android.app.Activity.onDestroy. No-op if called while SDK is not created.
      double[] getARRouteData()
      Get AR cubic spline of route.
      CalibrationProgress getCalibrationProgress() 
      float[] getCameraParams()
      Get camera params for AR.
      FrameSize getFrameSize() 
      FrameStatistics getFrameStatistics()
      Get frame statistics with FPS.
      LaneDepartureState getLaneDepartureState() 
      Position getPosition() 
      RoadDescription getRoadDescription() 
      WorldDescription getWorldDescription() 
      void init(android.app.Application application, java.lang.String mapboxToken)
      Initialize SDK with mapbox access token and application instance. Do it once per application session, eg in android.app.Application.onCreate.
      WorldCoordinate pixelToWorld(ScreenCoordinate screenCoordinate)
      Converts location of the point from screen coordinates to world coordinates.
      void setModelPerformanceConfig(ModelPerformanceConfig modelPerformanceConfig)
      Configure performance of ML models used.
      void setVideoStreamListener(VideoStreamListener videoStreamListener)
      Set listener
      void setVisionEventListener(VisionEventsListener visionEventsListener)
      Set listener to listen SDK events.
      void start()
      Start delivering events from SDK. Should be called with all permission granted, and after VisionManager.create is called. Typically this is called from android.app.Activity.onStart or android.app.Activity.onResume. No-op if called while SDK is started already.
      void startNavigation(NavigationRoute navigationRoute)
      Provide information about navigation route to get instructions on rendering AR navigation.
      void stop()
      Stop delivering events from SDK. Stops ML processing and video source. To resume call VisionManager.start again. Typically this is called from android.app.Activity.onStop or android.app.Activity.onPause. No-op if called while SDK is not created or started.
      void stopNavigation()
      Stop navigation.
      ScreenCoordinate worldToPixel(WorldCoordinate worldCoordinate)
      Converts location of the point from world coordinates to screen coordinates.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.mapbox.vision.ar.ARDataProvider

        getARRouteData, getCameraParams

    • Field Detail

      • INSTANCE

        public static VisionManager INSTANCE

        The main object for registering for events from the library, starting and stopping their delivery.

        It also provides some useful functions for performance configuration and data conversion.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(android.app.Application application,
                 java.lang.String mapboxToken)

        Initialize SDK with mapbox access token and application instance. Do it once per application session, eg in android.app.Application.onCreate.

        See Also:
        android.app.Application.onCreate

      • create

        public void create()

        Initialize SDK. Creates core services and allocates necessary resources. Typically is called when application need to launch Vision SDK, eg. android.app.Activity.onCreate. You should VisionManager.destroy when Vision SDK is no longer needed to release all resources. No-op if called while SDK is created already.

        See Also:
        android.app.Activity.onCreate, VisionManager.destroy

      • start

        public void start()

        Start delivering events from SDK. Should be called with all permission granted, and after VisionManager.create is called. Typically this is called from android.app.Activity.onStart or android.app.Activity.onResume. No-op if called while SDK is started already.

        See Also:
        VisionManager.create, android.app.Activity.onStart, android.app.Activity.onResume

      • stop

        public void stop()

        Stop delivering events from SDK. Stops ML processing and video source. To resume call VisionManager.start again. Typically this is called from android.app.Activity.onStop or android.app.Activity.onPause. No-op if called while SDK is not created or started.

        See Also:
        VisionManager.start, android.app.Activity.onStop, android.app.Activity.onPause

      • destroy

        public void destroy()

        Releases all resources. Typically this is called from android.app.Activity.onDestroy. No-op if called while SDK is not created.

        See Also:
        android.app.Activity.onDestroy

      • setVisionEventListener

        public void setVisionEventListener(VisionEventsListener visionEventsListener)

        Set listener to listen SDK events.

      • getRoadDescription

        public RoadDescription getRoadDescription()
        Returns:
        current road situation or NULL in case of data is not ready .
        Throws:
        - if called before VisionManager.create and VisionManager.start

        Throws:
        - if called before VisionManager.create and VisionManager.start

      • getCameraParams

        public float[] getCameraParams()

        Get camera params for AR.

        Returns:
        six camera parameters m_verticalFOV,-vertical field of view,in radiansm_aspectRatio,-aspect ratiom_roll,-roll,in radiansm_pitch,-pitch,in radiansm_yaw,-yaw,in radiansm_height-camera height,in meters
